Key Match Events: Brandon Miller's putback at the buzzer gave the Charlotte Hornets a 108-107 victory against the visiting Detroit Pistons in the NBA on Wednesday night.
LaMelo Ball scored five of his 25 points in the final minute to help the Hornets end a three-game losing streak.
Ronald Holland II's steal and basket in the final 10 seconds put the Pistons in position to win before Charlotte's time-out in advance of the final sequence.
Cade Cunningham recorded a triple-double of 20 points, 10 rebounds and 10 assists for the Pistons.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hornets made all 16 of their free throw attempts during the game, while the Pistons were 5-for-9 at the foul line.
Detroit lost center Jalen Duren, 20, to an injured left ankle after just eight minutes of playing time.
Charlotte had a third-quarter stretch of almost three minutes without scoring, but Williams' basket and Tidjane Salaun's 3-pointer provided a 69-64 lead.
Others: The game was played at Spectrum Center.
